column4: Apple poaches another luxury executive as iWatch nears
column5: PARIS  July 4 Apple has poached a senior executive from Swiss luxury watch brand Tag Heuer  which could be to help it with the launch of its iWatch expected this autumn.

column4: UPDATE 1-Airbus lags Boeing in order race despite busy June
column5: PARIS  July 4 Airbus sold more than 200 aircraft in June during an unexpectedly busy month that saw some reshuffling of its order book  but took over 120 cancellations to end the first half behind U.S. rival Boeing  company data showed on Friday.

column4: BT agrees insurance deal against pension longevity costs
column5: LONDON  July 4 Britain's BT has agreed an insurance and reinsurance deal to protect its pension scheme against the costs associated with increases in life expectancy  it said on Friday.

column4: UPDATE 2-CN says crude cars intact after Alberta train derailment
column5: TORONTO  July 4 A Canadian National Railway  train carrying crude oil derailed near Whitecourt  Alberta  early on Friday morning  the company said  but there were no injuries or fire and the crude cars were intact.

column4: CN train derails near Whitecourt  Alberta; no leaks - fire chief
column5: TORONTO  July 4 A Canadian National Railway  train carrying crude  gravel and lumber derailed near Whitecourt  Alberta early on Friday morning  the town's fire chief said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Italy prosecutors open probe into Eni on Nigeria oil block deal
column5: MILAN  July 4 Italian prosecutors have opened a probe into alleged corruption relating to the 2011 acquisition of a big oil field in Nigeria by Italian oil group Eni  and Shell  judicial sources with direct knowledge of the matter said on Friday.

column4: GM expects Cadillac China sales to increase by at least 40 pct this year
column5: SHANGHAI  July 4 General Motors Co  expects Cadillac sales in China to rise by at least 40 percent this year  as the U.S. carmaker steps up local production in a market key to transforming Cadillac into a global luxury brand  a senior executive said.

column4: GM to recall 27 051 Spark cars in Korea due to transmission defect
column5: SEOUL  July 4 General Motors Co will recall 27 051 Spark mini cars in South Korea due to a defective transmission mount  the latest in a string of global recalls by the U.S. automaker.

column4: U.S. 'concerned' about being barred from GSK-linked China trial
column5: SHANGHAI The United States is worried that its officials have been barred from attending the Aug. 7 trial in China of British investigator Peter Humphrey and his American wife Yu Yingzeng after the couple were arrested last year following work they did for British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline PLC.

column4: Blixt makes sizzling start to title defense
column5: Swede Jonas Blixt made a storming start to his title defense at The Greenbrier Classic in White Sulphur Springs  West Virginia on Thursday as he charged into a one-shot lead in the opening round.

column4: Honda says to expand U.S. regional air bag recall to include California
column5: TOKYO Honda Motor Co is expanding to the state of California a U.S. regional recall of vehicles over potentially explosive air bags made by Takata Corp  the automaker said on Friday  after a complaint that said a driver was injured in an accident in the state.

column4: UPDATE 2-Honda says to expand US regional air bag recall to include California
column5: * Comes after Honda learned of air bag incident in California

column4: Honda to expand US regional air bag recall to include California
column5: TOKYO  July 4 Honda Motor Co has expanded its U.S. regional recall of vehicles over potentially explosive air bags made by Takata Corp to include the state of California  one of the biggest markets for the automaker in the United States  a spokeswoman said on Friday.

column4: Former Itaú banker to become Latam CFO for HSBC -source
column5: SAO PAULO  July 4 Rogério Calderón  a former senior executive at Brazilian bank Itaú  has been tapped to become chief financial officer of HSBC in Latin America  according to a source with knowledge of the appointment.

column4: China approves Lenovo  IBM $2.3 billion server deal
column5: BEIJING The Chinese Ministry of Commerce's anti-monopoly bureau has approved Lenovo Group's proposed $2.3 billion deal to buy IBM Corp's low-end server business.

column4: Brazil's Itaú sees $497 mln earnings boost from ACE deal
column5: SAO PAULO  July 4 Itaú Unibanco Holding SA   Brazil's largest non-government bank  expects an earnings boost of 1.1 billion reais ($497 million) from the sale of its high-risk corporate insurance portfolio to global insurance company ACE Ltd  according to a Friday securities filing.

column4: Matteson sizzles with a 61 at Greenbrier Classic
column5: Troy Matteson briefly eyed a 59 as he snapped a season-long slump to match his lowest ever score on the PGA Tour with a 61 for fourth place after the second round of the Greenbrier Classic on Friday.

column4: U.S. grounds entire F-35 fleet pending engine inspections
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. military said it had grounded the entire fleet of 97 Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 fighter jets until completion of additional inspections of the warplane's single engine built by Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp.

column4: UPDATE 5-U.S. grounds entire F-35 fleet pending engine inspections
column5: * Japan Defense Minister to discuss issue on trip to U.S. next week

column4: U.S. grounds entire F-35 fleet pending engine inspections
column5: WASHINGTON  July 3 The U.S. military on Thursday said it had grounded the entire fleet of Lockheed Martin Corp  F-35 fighter jets until completion of additional inspections of the warplane's single engine built by Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp.

column4: Posco  Chongqing Iron & Steel sign agreement for $3.3 bln investment
column5: SEOUL  July 4 South Korean steelmaker Posco  and China's Chongqing Iron & Steel Co.  have signed a memorandum of understanding for a $3.3 billion investment  South Korea's trade ministry said on Friday.

column4: Sanofi warns of currency impact on earnings
column5: PARIS  July 4 French pharmaceutical group Sanofi  said in a statement on Friday that it estimates that negative foreign currency impact on its second-quarter 2014 financial results should be about 6 percentage points on sales and 8 to 10 percentage points on business earnings per share (EPS).

column4: Spain's Telefonica buys Mediaset Espana stake in Canal+
column5: MADRID Telefonica  said on Friday it had agreed to buy the 22 percent stake held by Mediaset Espana  in pay-TV firm Distribuidora de Television (DTS)  giving full ownership of the TV firm to the telecoms group.
